intro: Erigeron peregrinus, commonly known as the wandering bluemink, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Erigeron peregrinus is often found in the central and eastern United States, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
